data.title: Learnings from Movie "12th Fail"
data.meta_description: #Restart After a long time saw an impressive film that can inspire millions of people to dream big This narrative is about failing repeatedly and starting over each time to achieve your goal. The story is about true friendship, love, and family above all, {12th Fail}, which is based on Anurag Pathak
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

{12th Fail}, which is based on Anurag Pathak's novel, is a recognition of millions of students and their perseverance. The movie tells the true story of Manoj Kumar Sharma, an IPS officer from Chambal, a small town in India, who bravely started the preparation for the UPSC exams, one of the country's most difficult exams.

He failed, got back up, and then failed again. Upon experiencing every setback, he would analyse the pattern of his shortcomings and take steps to improve upon it.

Manoj elevated his concentration on the objective by viewing every criticism as a challenge. No matter how harsh the criticism or consequences, if you truly have a clear purpose or goal in life, you will follow the route to success.
